body_html:
What bug are you trying to demonstrate with this code?

I see two issues with your example:

  1. You need to call coord.request_stop()
  2. With string_input_producer only having one epoch, you will always get an OutOfRange exception before any of your bucket_by_sequence_length queues are full with 5 examples

Would you mind re-posting a minimal working example with the bug you are trying to highlight? Are you positive that bucket_by_sequence_length behaves the way you think it does?
body_text:
What bug are you trying to demonstrate with this code?
I see two issues with your example:

You need to call coord.request_stop()
With string_input_producer only having one epoch, you will always get an OutOfRange exception before any of your bucket_by_sequence_length queues are full with 5 examples

Would you mind re-posting a minimal working example with the bug you are trying to highlight? Are you positive that bucket_by_sequence_length behaves the way you think it does?
body:
What bug are you trying to demonstrate with this code?

I see two issues with your example:
1) You need to call `coord.request_stop()`
2) With `string_input_producer` only having one epoch, you will always get an `OutOfRange` exception before any of your `bucket_by_sequence_length` queues are full with 5 examples

Would you mind re-posting a minimal working example with the bug you are trying to highlight? Are you positive that `bucket_by_sequence_length` behaves the way you think it does?
